DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prolonged QT Interval Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to elements of a patient's medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial because of a QTc interval that is prolonged.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prolonged QT Interval Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to elements of a patient's medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial because of a QTc interval that is prolonged.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A QT interval that is prolonged. The length of the QT interval varies with the heart rate.:Elements of a personal medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.longName: Prolonged QT Interval by ECG Finding
Concepts.definition: An electrocardiographic finding in which the QT interval not corrected for heart rate is prolonged. Thresholds for different age, gender, and patient populations exist. (CDISC)
Elements of a personal medical history which would prevent an individual from participating in a specific clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prolonged QTc interval on pre-entry electrocardiogram (>450 msec)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have prolonged QTc interval greater than 450 ms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the repeat ECG demonstrate QTc <= 470 msec

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have prolonged QTc interval greater than 450 ms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a baseline QTc of > 450 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a QTc <470msec by Fridericia Formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the average QTc for the 3 ECGs < 480 milliseconds?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a corrected QT (QTc) interval less than 450 msec?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
